table.name: Asset
table.description: This table stores all the basic information about a asset item in an organization. The primary use for this information is to enable scheduling asset time just like provider time is scheduled.

column.name: asset_type
column.descr: The type of asset if 'Other' chosen above

column.name: concurrency
column.descr: How many people can use this asset concurrently? This is >1 for things like a ward or conference room but =1 for things like an x-ray machine. This field is used mainly to limit the number of Event_Asset records that link to a particular asset for a given time slot

column.name: location
column.descr: The location of this asset in (in)formal terms

column.name: serial_num
column.descr: The serial number of this asset (if any)

table.name: Asset_Maint
table.description: This table stores all maintenance records regarding a asset. This includes all the times it has had scheduled maintenance performed on it, any breakdowns that have occurred etc.

column.name: asset_id
column.descr: The asset that this record is about

column.name: scheduled
column.descr: Whether this was a scheduled maintenance or not

column.name: breakdown_date
column.descr: The date that the asset became unavailable. This makes sense only for non-scheduled maintenance.

column.name: maintenance_date
column.descr: The date that scheduled maintenance was conducted
